title: ‘Entitled’ driver parks between disabled spots at a children’s hospital
text:
Fitness vlogger Ashy Bines has responded to criticism of her parking in a disabled spot by saying no one with a disability goes to her gym so it doesn't matter if she parks there.

An “entitled” driver has been lashed for parking between two disabled spots in the carpark of a children’s hospital in Melbourne.

Photos of the car were shared online this week in Facebook group the Australian Disability Parking Wall of Shame.

The offending car squeezed between two disabled spots at The Royal Children’s Hospital in Melbourne about lunchtime on Wednesday.

“I called security but don’t know if they could do something about it,” a woman wrote on Facebook.

She said there were no visible disability passes attached to the car.

Many commenters were outraged by the brazen move in the hospital carpark.

“Holy crap some people are just ridiculous,” one commenter said.

“Some people need to reset their licence,” another said.

“It’s a very old car so maybe they are self entitled,” another commenter said. “Seriously though I would report them even though the car is only worth about $5000!!”

Another commenter on the post suggested the driver be reported to the local council. But others said it was unlikely the driver would be penalised because the car park was privately operated.

“Because it is a private carpark, they won’t do anything,” the commenter said. “I reported to the council once a car from a shopping centre, they told me I have to report it to the shopping centre because it is private.”

But another commenter said, “Security at public hospitals are licensed to issue parking fines.”

Drivers caught illegally parking in a disabled spot face hefty fines, and the offence carries a demerit point.
description: An “entitled” driver has been lashed for parking between two disabled spots in the carpark of a children’s hospital in Melbourne.
